journals.notes: This feature is still undergoing discussion, but I moved it to version:2.72, because we should only commit minor tweaks and bugfixes before our first stable release.

details.name: description
details.new_value:
*Mod-specific feature, shouldn’t be implemented by the engine. Sorry for the inconvenience*


As I already stated I'm in favor of increasing the modification/personalization possiblities in ET.
Weapon configs in which the server admin can configure the weapon handling (damage/firerate/clip size, etc) would be a very important step in that direction as he can already pretty much create a (whole) different environment by changing textures/skins and such.


//I was told to target it to rc4, please feel free to change that, as I don't know the whole work-amount you guys are facing.

details.name: description
details.old_value:
*Mod-specific feature, shouldn’t be implemented by the engine. Sorry for the inconvenience*


As I already stated I'm in favor of increasing the modification/personalization possiblities in ET.
Weapon configs in which the server admin can configure the weapon handling (damage/firerate/clip size, etc) would be a very important step in that direction as he can already pretty much create a (whole) different environment by changing textures/skins and such.


//I was told to target it to rc4, please feel free to change that, as I don't know the whole work-amount you guys are facing.

journals.notes:
I'm personally against this idea (my PoV can be found on forums).

keMoN wrote:
> Weapon configs in which the server admin can configure the weapon handling (damage/firerate/clip size, etc) would be a very important step in that direction as *he can already pretty much create a (whole) different environment by changing textures/skins and such*.
This part bothers me most. The mod shouldn't be called the same as original one in case it's completely different.

I'm strongly against this feature - I've seen too many misconfigurated servers where it's possible to change weapon values. And tbh ... is there a need for such a manuipulation? When people connect to a legacy mod server they shouldn't experience surprises. Thinking of competetive games and global ranks it's a no go.
Since we were waiting on user:IR4T4 's opinion and he is against this as well, we won't be implementing this feature.

subject: Add weapon configs [NQ like]
